alert.note: Alert for Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 5:00PM EDT until July 08 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Chester, Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Chester, Swarthmore, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Newtown Square, Broomall, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, Lima, Nether Providence Township, and Gradyville. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 336 and 337. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 14. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
